New Records: Carlos Rodón tied a Yankees World Series record by allowing three home runs.
Freddie Freeman hit the first walk-off grand slam in World Series history in Game 1.
Freddie Freeman has homered in four straight Series games dating to Atlanta's last two games against Houston in 2021, one shy of the record held by Astros outfielder George Springer.
Key Match Events: Shohei Ohtani partially dislocated his left shoulder on a slide at second base.
Tommy Edman and Teoscar Hernández hit home runs off Carlos Rodón.
Giancarlo Stanton hit an RBI single in the ninth inning.
Anthony Volpe struck out with the bases loaded, and Alex Vesia retired pinch-hitter Jose Trevino for his first postseason save.
Yoshinobu Yamamoto gave up Juan Soto's third-inning homer, then retired his last 11 batters.
Mookie Betts singled with two outs in the bottom half and Teoscar Hernández homered into the right-center pavilion.
Post-Match Reflections: Yankees manager Aaron Boone said, 'No one said it's going to be easy. It's a long series, and we need to make it a long series now. We won't flinch.'

Aaron Judge reflected on his performance, saying, 'Just expanding the zone. That's really what it really comes down to. I think it's trying to make things happen instead of letting the game come to you. ... Plain and simple, I've got to start swinging at strikes.'

Freddie Freeman commented on his ankle, 'I was able to calm my ankle down. So hopefully with the flight tonight — I've been swelling a lot on flights — so, hopefully tomorrow we can get it down and get in a good spot for Game 3.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Los Angeles took a 2-0 Series lead for the first time since 1988.
The Yankees are 0-2 for the first time since 2001, when they rebounded to win three straight at home and lost Games 6 and 7 at Arizona.
Yoshinobu Yamamoto turned down the Yankees last December and joined the Dodgers for a $325 million, 12-year contract, a record for pitchers.
